publicationstmt.publisher: Published by and available from the William Blake Archive, http://www.blakearchive.org

availability.p: ©2008 Morris Eaves, Robert N. Essick, Joseph Viscomi.

projectdesc.p: These collection lists were prepared for the William Blake Archive.

p.hi: None of the works in these collection lists is held at the offices of the William Blake Archive. Please contact the owning institution if you desire further information or wish to make arrangements to view any works.

div2.head: Designed by Blake and Engraved by Other Engravers
div2.bibl: Bürger, Gottfried. Leonora. 1796. Call no. fol. DELTA 673
Gough, Richard. Sepulchral Monuments, in Great Britain. 1786. Call no. Arch.Antiq. A III.8-10 (o.o.s.)
Gough, Richard. Sepulchral Monuments, in Great Britain. 1786. Call no. Duce G subt. 24-26

Gough, Richard. Sepulchral Monuments, in Great Britain. 1786. Extra-illustrated with proofs and preliminary drawings of the plates, correspondence related to the publication of the work, and other materials. The collection includes proofs before letters of the sixteen plates attributed to Blake's design.Call no. Gough Maps 221-228*
Gough, Richard. Sepulchral Monuments, in Great Britain. 1786. Copperplates for, including those based on drawings by Blake (and possibly engraved in part by him).Gough Collection

div2.head: Monochrome Wash Drawings
div2.bibl: Thirty-six preliminary wash drawings for the engravings in Richard Gough, Sepulchral Monuments in Great Britain, 1786. The drawings datable to c. 1774-77.Call no. Gough Maps 225

div1.head: Related Materials
div1.bibl: Bible. The Royal Universal Family Bible. 2 vols.1780-81. Prospectus for, with information on the engravings.John Johnson Collection

David Hume. The History of England. 5 vols.1806. Two prospectuses for, the earlier dated "January, 1792," both naming "W. Blake" as one of the engravers commissioned to execute plates for this work to be published by Robert Bowyer. Blake did not engrave any of the 195 plates in the published volumes.John Johnson Collection
Joseph Thomas. Religious Emblems. 1809. The "William Blake, Esq." in the list of subscribers may be the poet and artist.Call no. Douce SS 445
Illustrations of the Book of Job. Copperplates for facsimiles, reduced in size, of the plates numbered 5 and 21.Early twentieth-century? John Johnson Collection
